attributes.comment:
I strongly oppose the rate increase as related to adoptions. Many of us in the
adoptive community are required to re-apply for either approval or fingerprinting as
the wait for many international adoptions is taking longer and longer. Thus, we
are basically charged twice for something that is beyond our control. If we could
control the length of time it takes for the adoption, we certainly wouldn't prolong it
and let our paperwork expire. Many of us are already struggling to pay the fees
required to fulfill our American Dream of a family, and the proposed increases will
unfortunately eliminate many families from being able to accomplish this goal.
The wait is difficult enough, now we would also have the burden of outrageous fee
increases.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Adoptive Parent, Cynthia Croker
